emails.subject: User email address enumeration vulnerability on zalando.ee
emails.bodyHtml: Hello, During our research on user account enumeration flaws on Estonian online services, we found that your website is vulnerable to the exposure of registered user email addresses. The vulnerability report is attached. We would appreciate it if you could confirm receipt of this email to prevent us from reaching out to you through other channels. Best regards, Gregor Eesmaa Computer Science MSc student University of Tartu, Institute of Computer Science

emails.subject: Teie sõnum Zalandole
emails.bodyHtml:
Täname, et võtsite Zalandoga ühendust.
Saime teie sõnumi kätte. Meie klienditeenindus võtab teiega ühendust niipea kui võimalik.

See on automaatne vastus. Palun ärge sellele vastake.

Muuseas - meie "Abi ja kontakt" rubriigis leiate paljudele tavapärastele küsimustele vastuse.

Info teie tellimuse kohta

Tagastused & tagasimaksed

Maksed

Lisateabe saamiseks külastage meie "zalando.ee/faq" lehekülge.

Parimate soovidega,

Teie Zalando meeskond

--
Õigusteatis
Zalando.ee toob sinuni Zalando SE
Zalando SE, Valeska-Gert-Straße 5, 10243 Berliin, Saksamaa

Juhatus: Robert Gentz & David Schröder (juhatuse kaasesimehed), Dr. Astrid Arndt, David Schneider

Nõukogu esinaine: Kelly Bennett
Registreeritud: Amtsgericht Charlottenburg Berlin, HRB 158855 B

KMKR-number: DE 260543043
Maksunumber: 37/132/45004

Kõik hinnad sisaldavad käibemaksu. Ainult kuni laos kaupa jätkub. Kõik hinnad võivad muutuda. Zalando SE on loovutanud oma nõuded seoses eespool nimetatud ostuga ettevõttele Zalando Payments GmbH.

Zalando SE sisu eest vastutab: Robert Gentz

See on automaatne e-kiri, palun ära sellele vasta. Lisateavet ühenduse võtmise kohta leiad meie spikri ja kontaktteabe lehtedelt.

emails.subject: IKÜM taotlus seoses isikuandmete töötlemisega teenuses zalando.ee / GDPR Request Regarding Processing of Personal Data on zalando.ee
emails.bodyHtml: Lugupeetud zalando.ee vastutav andmetöötleja Pöördun, et edastada ametlikult mure isikuandmete kaitse üldmääruse (IKÜM) alusel seoses minu isikuandmete töötlemisega teenuses zalando.ee, mida pean ebaseaduslikuks ning mis võib viia nende avaldamiseni selleks volitamata isikutele ilma selge õigusliku aluseta. Manuses on ametlik taotlus, milles teostan oma õigusi IKÜM artiklite 15, 18 ja 21 alusel. Palun selle läbivaatust ja vastavate meetmete võtmist ajaraamis, mis on sätestatud IKÜM artiklis 12(3) (üks kuu taotluse saamisest). Palun teavitage taotluse kättesaamisest. Lugupidamisega Gregor Eesmaa -- Dear Data Controller of zalando.ee, I am contacting you to formally raise concerns under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) regarding what I believe to be the unlawful processing of my personal data by zalando.ee, potentially leading to its disclosure to unauthorised parties without a clear legal basis. Please find attached a formal application exercising my rights under Articles 15, 18, and 21 of the GDPR. I request that you review and act upon it accordingly, within the timeframe established by Article 12(3) of the GDPR (one month from receipt). Please confirm receipt of this request. Kind regards, Gregor Eesmaa

emails.subject: Re: IKÜM taotlus seoses isikuandmete töötlemisega teenuses zalando.ee / GDPR Request Regarding Processing of Personal Data on zalando.ee
emails.bodyHtml:
Saadan igaks juhuks ka eraldi taotluse ja aruande PDFid, mis asusid eelmise meili manuses digiallkirjastatud konteineris.

Lugupidamisega
Gregor Eesmaa

--

Just in case, providing also the request and the report PDF files, that were in the digitally signed container attached to the previous email.

Kind regards,
Gregor Eesmaa

emails.subject: Päring teie tellimuse  asjus.
emails.bodyHtml:
Naised Mehed Lapsed
 
Tere Gregor!
 

Thank you for your message. I will pass your request and concern to our internal department for investigation. Will come back to you within 7 working days.


 
 
Best Regards,
 
Anna Jaunzeme
 
 
Otsi inspiratsiooni
 
Osta lihtsalt
 
 
Õigusteatis
Zalando.ee toob sinuni Zalando SE
Zalando SE, Valeska-Gert-Straße 5, 10243 Berliin, Saksamaa
 
Juhatus: Robert Gentz & David Schröder (juhatuse kaasesimehed), Dr. Astrid Arndt, David Schneider
 
Nõukogu esinaine: Kelly Bennett
Registreeritud: Amtsgericht Charlottenburg Berlin, HRB 158855 B
 
KMKR-number: DE 260543043
Maksunumber: 37/132/45004
 
Kõik hinnad sisaldavad käibemaksu. Ainult kuni laos kaupa jätkub. Kõik hinnad võivad muutuda. Zalando SE on loovutanud oma nõuded seoses eespool nimetatud ostuga ettevõttele Zalando Payments GmbH.

Zalando SE sisu eest vastutab: Robert Gentz
 
 
 
 


ref:!00D0Y0Ztg8.!500bi0BXx4v:ref

llmAnalysis.thinking:
**GDPR Response Analysis: A Deep Dive**

Okay, so I've got this email response to a GDPR request, and my task is to break it down and convert it into a JSON object according to the specified schema. Let's see...

First, I need to analyze the email.  From the sender's address and the footer, I can tell it's from Anna Jaunzeme at Zalando SE. The recipient is Gregor. The email uses both Estonian (for the greeting and footer) and English (for the main message), so the languages I'm using are both "et" and "en."

The tone is undeniably formal, with a standard "Best Regards" closing.  The content itself is straightforward: acknowledgement of Gregor's request, a promise to forward it internally, and a commitment to get back within seven business days. Crucially, it doesn't actually *address* the specific GDPR rights Gregor is exercising (Articles 15, 18, and 21).

Mapping this to the schema is next.  The language of the substantive response is English. "is_formal" gets a "true" because it's a standard business reply.  Since the email doesn't address the request directly, it gets an "addresses_request" of "no". I have to include the names "Gregor," "Anna Jaunzeme," and the names in the footer, which are Robert Gentz, David Schröder, Dr. Astrid Arndt, David Schneider, and Kelly Bennett, as personal data.

"extension_explicitly_requested" is "false" here. The seven-day timeframe is for a follow-up, not a request for an extension of the one-month statutory deadline.  "extension_deadline" and "extension_reasons" are, of course, "null" because no extension is requested.  For the "acknowledgement" field, since they're just acknowledging receipt, and not specifically the vulnerability at hand, I think "not_mentioned" is the most accurate. They are merely acknowledging receiving a request and concern.

As there is no legal basis cited for why the request can not be fulfilled, "justification_explicit_article6_paragraph1_points" is "null," along with "justification_topics." Remediation isn't mentioned either, so both "remediation_status" and "remediation_scope" are "not_mentioned" and the "remediation_finish_date" is "null."

I then constructed the JSON object based on these analyses.

After a thorough review, all the fields seem to align perfectly with the email's content and the schema requirements. Languages are accurate. The tone is formal. The request is not addressed. Personal data is accurate. The email does not ask for an extension of the deadline. No legal basis or remediation are discussed. I'm satisfied that this JSON accurately represents the email and that it complies with the schema.

emails.subject: Päring teie tellimuse  asjus.
emails.bodyHtml:
Naised Mehed Lapsed
 
Hello Gregor!
 

We are sorry for the long waiting time.
Our internal teams have evaluated your request and after thorough checks Im afraid we do not see the relevant vulnerability in this situation.

We stay at your disposal for any further questions or concerns,


 
 
Best Regards,
 
Anna Jaunzeme
 
 
Otsi inspiratsiooni
 
Osta lihtsalt
 
 
Õigusteatis
Zalando.ee toob sinuni Zalando SE
Zalando SE, Valeska-Gert-Straße 5, 10243 Berliin, Saksamaa
 
Juhatus: Robert Gentz & David Schröder (juhatuse kaasesimehed), Dr. Astrid Arndt, David Schneider
 
Nõukogu esinaine: Kelly Bennett
Registreeritud: Amtsgericht Charlottenburg Berlin, HRB 158855 B
 
KMKR-number: DE 260543043
Maksunumber: 37/132/45004
 
Kõik hinnad sisaldavad käibemaksu. Ainult kuni laos kaupa jätkub. Kõik hinnad võivad muutuda. Zalando SE on loovutanud oma nõuded seoses eespool nimetatud ostuga ettevõttele Zalando Payments GmbH.

Zalando SE sisu eest vastutab: Robert Gentz
 
 
 
 


ref:!00D0Y0Ztg8.!500bi0BXx4v:ref

llmAnalysis.thinking:
**My Analysis of the GDPR Response**

Alright, let's break this down. I've got an email here from Zalando, responding to a GDPR request regarding a perceived account enumeration vulnerability. My initial assessment is that this is a straightforward denial, so I need to analyze it carefully and map it to the defined JSON schema.

First off, the language is primarily English, which is the "substantive" response. The Estonian elements in the template are just that, a template. Therefore, `languages` will be `["en"]`. The email's structure and tone are professional, using standard closings and formal language, even if it lacks explicit legal references. So, `is_formal` is `true`.

Now, the crucial point: does it *address* the request? While it acknowledges the request and responds, it sidesteps the specific GDPR articles (15, 18, 21) that were likely the focus of the request. It doesn't offer a legal basis, restrict processing, or even argue against restriction directly. It's simply denying the existence of the vulnerability. Hence, `addresses_request` will be `"no"`.

As for the personal data, I've got the names "Gregor" and "Anna Jaunzeme" in the body and the board members listed in the footer. That is: `["Gregor", "Anna Jaunzeme", "Robert Gentz", "David Schröder", "Dr. Astrid Arndt", "David Schneider", "Kelly Bennett"]`.

The email doesn't ask for more time, so `extension_explicitly_requested` is `false`. That also means the other extension-related fields are `null`.

The core of the email is the denial, the line "we do not see the relevant vulnerability". The correct choice for `acknowledgement` here is `"disagree"`.

Given that they aren't citing Article 6, `justification_explicit_article6_paragraph1_points` will be `null`. The implicit justification is that there's no risk to process data further (due to the denial), so for `justification_topics`, it would be `["denial_of_risk"]`.

Consequently, as the problem is denied, they are not planning any changes, it is `remediation_status` `"refused"`, and thus the `remediation_scope` will be `"not_mentioned"`. Obviously, `remediation_finish_date` is `null`.

I've reviewed the analysis, and I'm confident in the values. I'll now put together the final JSON object based on this analysis.

emails.subject: Re: Päring teie tellimuse  asjus.
emails.bodyHtml:
Hello Anna!

Thank you for your reply! I am writing to clarify the security vulnerability that allows unauthorized parties to learn whether I have an account with Zalando.

Under GDPR, the fact that I am a Zalando customer is my personal data. Your website discloses this information in two ways:
1. Login and Registration Form: If someone enters my email address (gregoreesmaal@gmail.com), the website's response is different depending on whether my account exists. It either proceeds to a login page (if the account exists) or a registration page (if it does not). This indicates to any person whether I have a Zalando account.
2. Email Change Form: When trying to change an account's email to one that is already registered, the form displays a specific error message: "See meiliaadress on juba olemas" ("This email address already exists"). This also confirms the existence of my account to anyone who enters my email address.

These issues are detailed in the vulnerability report I sent previously. The report explains how this "account enumeration" vulnerability works and offers clear, standard methods for fixing it.

My formal GDPR request from May 31, 2025, which asked for the legal basis for this data processing (Article 15), requested a restriction on this processing (Article 18), and objected to it (Article 21), remains unanswered.
Could you please re-evaluate this situation based on the clarification and report provided and respond to my formal GDPR requests?

Best regards
Gregor Eesmaa
